meanings.definition: (verb) moves through the air using wings
meanings.sent1: The bird flies high in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The airplane flies passengers to different countries.
meanings.sent3: The superhero flies faster than a speeding bullet.
meanings.sent4: Time flies when you're having fun.
meanings.sent5: The kite flies gracefully in the wind.

meanings.sent1: I saw many flies buzzing around the garbage can.
meanings.sent2: Flies can be annoying during a picnic.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen was full of flies after leaving fruit out.
meanings.sent4: The flies gathered around the ripe fruit like a tiny cloud.
meanings.sent5: The flies landed on the picnic food, causing a commotion.

meanings.definition: (noun) the plural form of fly (a zipper on clothing)
meanings.sent1: She quickly fixed the broken flies on her jacket.
meanings.sent2: The tailor replaced the flies on the pants with new ones.
meanings.sent3: He struggled to zip up the flies on his backpack.
meanings.sent4: The flies on the jacket were stuck, making it hard to close.
meanings.sent5: The flies on the dress were shiny and easy to use.
